001package com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor;
002
003import com.qualcomm.hardware.rev.RevHubOrientationOnRobot;
004import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngleUnit;
005import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngularVelocity;
006import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AxesOrder;
007import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AxesReference;
008import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.Orientation;
009
010/**
011 * Class for the IMU (Inertial Movement Units) that implements the IGyro interface
012 */
013@SuppressWarnings("unused")
014public class IMU extends Sensor<com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU> implements IGyro {
015
016    private Orientation orientation;
017    public AngularVelocity angularVelocity;
018
019    // TODO: Make this report zero-ing info properly
020    @Override
021    public String LogLine() {
022        return logData(
023            String.format("%f1.3,%f1.3,%f1.3 ", orientation.firstAngle, orientation.secondAngle, orientation.thirdAngle)
024        );
025    }
026
027    /**
028     * The direction of the axes signs when remapping the axes
029     *
030     * Probably don't use this stuff. Just use the IMU direction from the 8.1 and later SDK
031     */
032    @Deprecated
033    public enum AxesSigns {
034        /**
035         * Positive, Positive, Positive
036         */
037        PPP(0b000),
038        /**
039         * Positive, Positive, Negative
040         */
041        PPN(0b001),
042        /**
043         * Positive, Negative, Positive
044         */
045        PNP(0b010),
046        /**
047         * Positive, Negative, Negative
048         */
049        PNN(0b011),
050        /**
051         * Negative, Positive, Positive
052         */
053        NPP(0b100),
054        /**
055         * Negative, Positive, Negative
056         */
057        NPN(0b101),
058        /**
059         * Negative, Negative, Positive
060         */
061        NNP(0b110),
062        /**
063         * Negative, Negative, Negative
064         */
065        NNN(0b111);
066
067        /**
068         * The value of the enumeration
069         */
070        public int bVal;
071
072        /**
073         * Sets the enum to the integer
074         *
075         * @param bVal The value (should be 0-7)
076         */
077        AxesSigns(int bVal) {
078            this.bVal = bVal;
079        }
080    }
081
082    // This is the preferred units (Degrees/radians)
083    private AngleUnit preferred = AngleUnit.DEGREES;
084    // This is an offset from 0 so we can zero the IMU without needing to be facing forward
085    private double angleOffset;
086    private AxesOrder axesOrder;
087    private AxesSigns axesSigns;
088
089    /**
090     * Make an imu
091     *
092     * Use the Logo/Usb Facing direction API's as part of the FTC 8.1+ SDK
093     */
094    protected IMU(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU device, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters params) {
095        super(device, "imu");
096        angleOffset = 0.0;
097
098        axesSigns = AxesSigns.PPP;
099        axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZXY;
100
101        degrees();
102        initialize(params);
103    }
104
105    /**
106     * Make an imu
107     *
108     * Use the Logo/Usb Facing direction API's as part of the FTC 8.1+ SDK
109     */
110    protected IMU(String deviceName, com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters params) {
111        super(deviceName);
112        angleOffset = 0.0;
113
114        axesSigns = AxesSigns.PPP;
115        axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZXY;
116
117        degrees();
118        initialize(params);
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Make an imu
123     *
124     * @param device The imu device
125     */
126    public IMU(
127        com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU device,
128        RevHubOrientationOnRobot.LogoFacingDirection logo,
129        RevHubOrientationOnRobot.UsbFacingDirection usb
130    ) {
131        this(device, new com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters(new RevHubOrientationOnRobot(logo, usb)));
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Make an imu
136     *
137     * @param deviceName The device name in hardware map
138     */
139    public IMU(
140        String deviceName,
141        RevHubOrientationOnRobot.LogoFacingDirection logo,
142        RevHubOrientationOnRobot.UsbFacingDirection usb
143    ) {
144        this(deviceName, new com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters(new RevHubOrientationOnRobot(logo, usb)));
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Set angle format to degrees
149     *
150     * @return this
151     */
152    public IMU degrees() {
153        // Convert the angle offset!
154        angleOffset = AngleUnit.DEGREES.fromUnit(preferred, angleOffset);
155        preferred = AngleUnit.DEGREES;
156        return this;
157    }
158
159    /**
160     * Set angle format to radians
161     *
162     * @return this (for chaining)
163     */
164    public IMU radians() {
165        // Convert the angle offset!
166        angleOffset = AngleUnit.RADIANS.fromUnit(preferred, angleOffset);
167        preferred = AngleUnit.RADIANS;
168        return this;
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * Initialize the IMU
173     *
174     * @return the IMU (for chaining)
175     */
176    public IMU initialize(com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.IMU.Parameters imuParams) {
177        getRawDevice().initialize(imuParams);
178        return this;
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Get gyro heading
183     *
184     * @return The gyro heading (in preferred units, from -180/pi to +180/pi
185     */
186    @Override
187    public double gyroHeading() {
188        return getAngularOrientation().firstAngle;
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Get the gyro heading in the provided units
193     *
194     * @param unit the unit desired
195     * @return The heading in 'unit' units from -180/pi to +180/pi
196     */
197    public double gyroHeading(AngleUnit unit) {
198        return unit.fromUnit(preferred, gyroHeading() - angleOffset);
199    }
200
201    /**
202     * Gets the gyro heading in degrees
203     *
204     * @return the heading
205     */
206    @Override
207    public double gyroHeadingInDegrees() {
208        return gyroHeading(AngleUnit.DEGREES);
209    }
210
211    /**
212     * Gets the gyro heading in radians
213     *
214     * @return the heading
215     */
216    @Override
217    public double gyroHeadingInRadians() {
218        return gyroHeading(AngleUnit.RADIANS);
219    }
220
221    /**
222     * Sets the current heading to be 'new heading'
223     *
224     * @param newHeading The new heading (in default units)
225     */
226    @Override
227    public void setHeading(double newHeading) {
228        angleOffset = gyroHeading() - newHeading;
229    }
230
231    /**
232     * Remaps the axes for the IMU in the order and sign provided.
233     * This is using the 8.1.1+ IMU axis order:
234     * - Z up from the Control Hub
235     * - X positive toward the sensor connector side (I2C, etc...)
236     * - Y positive toward the USB connector end
237     *
238     * @param order The axis order desired
239     * @param signs The signs desired
240     * @return this (for chaining)
241     */
242    public IMU remapAxesAndSigns(AxesOrder order, AxesSigns signs) {
243        axesSigns = signs;
244        axesOrder = order;
245        return this;
246    }
247
248    /**
249     * Remaps the axes for the BNO055 IMU in the order and sign provided
250     * The SDK 8.1.1 added a new IMU class, which (delightfully) rotated
251     * the X and Y axes around the Z axis by 90 degrees clock-wise (viewed from above)
252     * If you have code that was using that layout, this is what you probably need to call.
253     * I expect to delete this code eventually. Also: it's really not tested at all...
254     *
255     * @param legacyOrder The *legacy* axis order desired
256     * @param legacySigns The *legacy* signs desired
257     * @return this (for chaining)
258     */
259    @Deprecated
260    public IMU remapLegacyAxes(AxesOrder legacyOrder, AxesSigns legacySigns) {
261        // The BNO055 has the X and Y axes rotated 90 degrees :/
262        // These are *very* untested
263        switch (legacyOrder) {
264            case XZX:
265                axesOrder = AxesOrder.YZY;
266                break;
267            case XYX:
268                axesOrder = AxesOrder.YXY;
269                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PNP.bVal;
270                break;
271            case YXY:
272                axesOrder = AxesOrder.XYX;
273                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.NPN.bVal;
274                break;
275            case YZY:
276                axesOrder = AxesOrder.XZX;
277                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.NPN.bVal;
278                break;
279            case ZYZ:
280                axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZXZ;
281                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PNP.bVal;
282                break;
283            case ZXZ:
284                axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZYZ;
285                break;
286            case XZY:
287                axesOrder = AxesOrder.YZX;
288                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PPN.bVal;
289                break;
290            case XYZ:
291                axesOrder = AxesOrder.YXZ;
292                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PNP.bVal;
293                break;
294            case YXZ:
295                axesOrder = AxesOrder.XYZ;
296                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.NPP.bVal;
297                break;
298            case YZX:
299                axesOrder = AxesOrder.XZY;
300                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.NPP.bVal;
301                break;
302            case ZYX:
303                axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZXY;
304                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PNP.bVal;
305                break;
306            case ZXY:
307                axesOrder = AxesOrder.ZYX;
308                axesSigns.bVal = legacySigns.bVal ^ AxesSigns.PPN.bVal;
309                break;
310        }
311        return this;
312    }
313
314    /**
315     * Gets the angular velocity (in default units)
316     *
317     * @return The Angular Velocity
318     */
319    public AngularVelocity getAngularVelocity(AngleUnit units) {
320        angularVelocity = getRawDevice().getRobotAngularVelocity(units);
321        return angularVelocity;
322    }
323
324    public AngularVelocity getAngularVelocity() {
325        return getAngularVelocity(preferred);
326    }
327
328    /**
329     * Gets the Angular orientation of the IMU
330     *
331     * @return the Orientation of the IMU
332     */
333    public Orientation getAngularOrientation(AngleUnit units) {
334        orientation = getRawDevice().getRobotOrientation(AxesReference.INTRINSIC, axesOrder, units);
335        if ((axesSigns.bVal & AxesSigns.NPP.bVal) == AxesSigns.NPP.bVal) {
336            orientation.firstAngle = -orientation.firstAngle;
337        }
338        if ((axesSigns.bVal & AxesSigns.PNP.bVal) == AxesSigns.PNP.bVal) {
339            orientation.secondAngle = -orientation.secondAngle;
340        }
341        if ((axesSigns.bVal & AxesSigns.PPN.bVal) == AxesSigns.PPN.bVal) {
342            orientation.thirdAngle = -orientation.thirdAngle;
343        }
344        return orientation;
345    }
346
347    public Orientation getAngularOrientation() {
348        return getAngularOrientation(preferred);
349    }
350}
